table.name: agency_code
table.remarks: An agency is an organized and named grouping of people that interacts in some way with the Ministry.

column.name: agency_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an agency.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the agency code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the agency code.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the agency code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the agency code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the agency code.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the agency code.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the agency was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the agency code.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the agency code.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the agency was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: allegation_complaint
table.remarks: A complaint for which a caller believes that a Violation has occurred and should be investigated.

column.name: allegation_complaint_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an allegation complaint. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: in_progress_ind
column.remarks: True if the alleged violation is currently described as being in progress. False otherwise.

column.name: observed_ind
column.remarks: True if the alleged violation was observed first hand. False otherwise.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the allegation complaint.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the allegation complaint.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the allegation complaint was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the allegation complaint.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the allegation complaint.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the allegation complaint was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: complaint_identifier
column.remarks: Natural key for a complaint generated by webEOC.

column.name: violation_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a violation.

table.name: allegation_complaint_h
table.remarks: History table for allegation_complaint table

column.name: h_algtncmplt_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for allegation complaint history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the allegation complaint that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the allegation complaint table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the allegation complaint table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: attractant_code
table.remarks: A human factor contributing to a Human Wildlife Conflict (E.g. RESFRUIT = Residential Fruit/Berries; LVSFEED = Livestock Feed)

column.name: attractant_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an attractant.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the attractant code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the attractant code.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the attractant code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind

column.name: create_user_id

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the attractant code.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the attractant code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the attractant code.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the attractant code.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the attractant code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: attractant_hwcr_xref
table.remarks: Cross reference table for linking attractants to HWCR Complaints.

column.name: attractant_hwcr_xref_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an attractant hwcr relationship. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: attractant_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an attractant.

column.name: hwcr_complaint_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a hwcr complaint.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the attractant hwcr cross reference.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the attractant hwcr cross reference.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the attractant hwcr cross reference was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the attractant hwcr cross reference.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the attractant hwcr cross reference.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the attractant hwcr cross reference was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: attractant_hwcr_xref_h
table.remarks: History table for attractant_hwcr_xref table

column.name: h_attrhwcrx_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for attractant hwcr xref history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the attractant hwcr xref that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the attractant hwcr xref table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the attractant hwcr xref table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: complaint
table.remarks: Initial information provided on a potential incident.

column.name: detail_text
column.remarks: Verbatim details of the complaint as recorded by the call centre or through the web form.

column.name: caller_name
column.remarks: The name provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: caller_address
column.remarks: The address provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: caller_email
column.remarks: The email address provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: caller_phone_1
column.remarks: The primary phone number provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: caller_phone_2
column.remarks: An alternate phone number provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: caller_phone_3
column.remarks: An alternate phone number provided by the caller to the call centre or entered onto the web form.

column.name: location_summary_text
column.remarks: A brief summary of the location of the complaint.

column.name: location_detailed_text
column.remarks: A more detailed description of the location of the complaint.

column.name: incident_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time at which the complaint occurred.

column.name: incident_reported_datetime
column.remarks: The date and time at which the complaint was reported.

column.name: referred_by_agency_other_text
column.remarks: Provides a more detailed description when the referred by Agency is of type "OTHER"

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the complaint.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the complaint.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the complaint.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the complaint.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: referred_by_agency_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an agency. The agency that originally referred the complaint.

column.name: owned_by_agency_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an agency. The agency that currently owns the complaint.

column.name: complaint_status_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a complaint status.

column.name: geo_organization_unit_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a geographical organization unit. The finest known grain geographical organization unit where the complaint occurred.

column.name: location_geometry_point
column.remarks: The closest approximation to where the incident occurred. Stored as a geometric point using the EPSG:3005 Projected Coordinate System (BC Albers)

table.name: complaint_h
table.remarks: History table for complaint table

column.name: h_complaint_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for complaint history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the complaint that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the complaint table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the complaint table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: complaint_status_code
table.remarks: The status of a Complaint. Values include OPEN = Open and CLOSED = Closed.

column.name: complaint_status_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a complaint status.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the complaint status code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the complaint status code.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the complaint status code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the complaint status code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the complaint status code.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the complaint status code.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint status code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the complaint status code.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the complaint status code.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the complaint status code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: geo_org_unit_structure
table.remarks: A geographical organization unit structure is a parent/child relationship between two geographical organization units.

column.name: geo_org_unit_structure_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a geographical organization unit structure. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date the Geographical Organizational Unit Structure becomes effective as a valid relationship within the Ministry organizational structure.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date the Geographical Organizational Unit Structure is no longer recognized as a valid relationship within the Ministry organizational structure.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the geographical organization unit structure.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the geographical organization unit structure.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the geographical organization unit structure was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the geographical organization unit structure.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the geographical organization unit structure.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the geographical organization unit structure was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: agency_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an agency. The agency that defines the geographical organization unit structural relationship.

column.name: parent_geo_org_unit_code
column.remarks: The geographical organization that contains the child geographical organization unit.

column.name: child_geo_org_unit_code
column.remarks: The geographical organization that is contained by the parent geographical organization unit.

table.name: geo_org_unit_structure_h
table.remarks: History table for geo_org_unit_structure table

column.name: h_gorgustrct_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for geographic organization unit structure history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the geographic organization unit structure that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the geographic organization unit structure table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the geographic organization unit structure table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: geo_org_unit_type_code
table.remarks: A geographical organization unit type describes the level of granularity for a given geographical organization unit. Supported geographical organization unit types are (ZONE = Zone; REGION = Region; OFFLOC = Office Location; AREA = Area).

column.name: geo_org_unit_type_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a geographical organization unit type.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the geographical organization unit type code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the geographical organization unit type code.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the geographical organization unit type code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the geographical organization unit type code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the geographical organization unit type code.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the geographical organization unit type code.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the geographical organization unit type code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the geographical organization unit type code.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the geographical organization unit type code.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the geographical organization unit type code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: geo_organization_unit_code
table.remarks: A geographical organization unit is a named geographical boundary that represents a physical location. The level of granularity can vary with Regions being the highest level - for example Okanagan, and Areas being the lowest level - for example Big White

column.name: geo_organization_unit_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a geographical organization unit.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the geographical organization unit code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the geographical organization unit code.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date the Geographical Organizational Unit becomes effective as a boundaried physical location within the Ministry organizational structure.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date the Geographical Organizational Unit is no longer recognized as a valid physical location within the Ministry organizational structure.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the geographical organization unit code.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the geographical organization unit code.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the geographical organization unit code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the geographical organization unit code.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the geographical organization unit code.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the geographical organization unit code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: geo_org_unit_type_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a geographical organization unit type.

table.name: geography_columns
table.viewSql: SELECT current_database() AS f_table_catalog, n.nspname AS f_table_schema, c.relname AS f_table_name, a.attname AS f_geography_column, postgis_typmod_dims(a.atttypmod) AS coord_dimension, postgis_typmod_srid(a.atttypmod) AS srid, postgis_typmod_type(a.atttypmod) AS type FROM pg_class c, pg_attribute a, pg_type t, pg_namespace n WHERE ((t.typname = 'geography'::name) AND (a.attisdropped = false) AND (a.atttypid = t.oid) AND (a.attrelid = c.oid) AND (c.relnamespace = n.oid) AND (c.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'v'::"char", 'm'::"char", 'f'::"char", 'p'::"char"])) AND (NOT pg_is_other_temp_schema(c.relnamespace)) AND has_table_privilege(c.oid, 'SELECT'::text));

table.name: geometry_columns
table.viewSql: SELECT (current_database())::character varying(256) AS f_table_catalog, n.nspname AS f_table_schema, c.relname AS f_table_name, a.attname AS f_geometry_column, COALESCE(postgis_typmod_dims(a.atttypmod), sn.ndims, 2) AS coord_dimension, COALESCE(NULLIF(postgis_typmod_srid(a.atttypmod), 0), sr.srid, 0) AS srid, (replace(replace(COALESCE(NULLIF(upper(postgis_typmod_type(a.atttypmod)), 'GEOMETRY'::text), st.type, 'GEOMETRY'::text), 'ZM'::text, ''::text), 'Z'::text, ''::text))::character varying(30) AS type FROM ((((((pg_class c JOIN pg_attribute a ON (((a.attrelid = c.oid) AND (NOT a.attisdropped)))) JOIN pg_namespace n ON ((c.relnamespace = n.oid))) JOIN pg_type t ON ((a.atttypid = t.oid))) LEFT JOIN ( SELECT s.connamespace, s.conrelid, s.conkey, replace(split_part(s.consrc, ''''::text, 2), ')'::text, ''::text) AS type FROM ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE (s.consrc ~~* '%geometrytype(% = %'::text)) st ON (((st.connamespace = n.oid) AND (st.conrelid = c.oid) AND (a.attnum = ANY (st.conkey))))) LEFT JOIN ( SELECT s.connamespace, s.conrelid, s.conkey, (replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = '::text, 2), ')'::text, ''::text))::integer AS ndims FROM ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE (s.consrc ~~* '%ndims(% = %'::text)) sn ON (((sn.connamespace = n.oid) AND (sn.conrelid = c.oid) AND (a.attnum = ANY (sn.conkey))))) LEFT JOIN ( SELECT s.connamespace, s.conrelid, s.conkey, (replace(replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = '::text, 2), ')'::text, ''::text), '('::text, ''::text))::integer AS srid FROM ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE (s.consrc ~~* '%srid(% = %'::text)) sr ON (((sr.connamespace = n.oid) AND (sr.conrelid = c.oid) AND (a.attnum = ANY (sr.conkey))))) WHERE ((c.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'v'::"char", 'm'::"char", 'f'::"char", 'p'::"char"])) AND (NOT (c.relname = 'raster_columns'::name)) AND (t.typname = 'geometry'::name) AND (NOT pg_is_other_temp_schema(c.relnamespace)) AND has_table_privilege(c.oid, 'SELECT'::text));

table.name: hwcr_complaint
table.remarks: A complaint that a caller believes could involve a conflict between Humans and Wildlife.

column.name: hwcr_complaint_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for a hwcr complaint. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: other_attractants_text
column.remarks: Provides a more detailed description when the attractant of type "OTHER" is included.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the HWCR complaint.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the HWCR complaint.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the HWCR complaint was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the HWCR complaint.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the HWCR complaint.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the HWCR complaint was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: complaint_identifier
column.remarks: Natural key for a complaint generated by webEOC.

column.name: species_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a wildlife species.

column.name: hwcr_complaint_nature_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify the nature of the Human Wildlife Conflict.

table.name: hwcr_complaint_h
table.remarks: History table for hwcr_complaint table

column.name: h_hwcrcmplt_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for HWCR complaint history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the HWCR complaint that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the HWCR complaint table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the HWCR complaint table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: hwcr_complaint_nature_code
table.remarks: Modifier that further describes the nature of Human Wildlife Conflict complaints. (E.g. DEADNV = Dead wildlife - no violation suspected; TRAP = Wildlife in trap)

column.name: hwcr_complaint_nature_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify the nature of the Human Wildlife Conflict.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the nature of the Human Wildlife Conflict code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the nature of the Human Wildlife Conflict code.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the nature of the Human Wildlife Conflict code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the nature of the Human Wildlife Conflict code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the human wildlife conflict nature code.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the human wildlife conflict nature code.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the human wildlife conflict nature code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the human wildlife conflict nature code.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the human wildlife conflict nature code.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the human wildlife conflict nature code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: office
table.remarks: An office is a physical location that serves as a central organization point for groups of users of the system.

column.name: office_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an office. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: create_user_id

column.name: create_user_guid

column.name: create_timestamp

column.name: update_user_id

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the office.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the office was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: geo_organization_unit_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a geographical organization unit. The geographical unit where the office is located. This might not necessarily be the lowest level in the geographical organizational unit hierarchy.

column.name: agency_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify an agency. The agency that owns the office.

column.name: operation_executed_at

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: officer
table.remarks: An officer is a subtype of a person who can be identified through their IDIR.

column.name: officer_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an officer. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: The IDIR ID issued to the user by the Government of British Columbia as part of their employment.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the officer.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the the officer.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the officer was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the officer.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the officer.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the officer was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: person_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an person.

column.name: office_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an office. The primary office an officer is assigned to.

table.name: officer_h
table.remarks: History table for officer table

column.name: h_officer_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for officer history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the officer that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the officer table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the officer table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: person
table.remarks: A person is an individual that is being tracked explicitly within the system. The criteria for being included as a trackable individual is the possession of a unique identifier that can be used for dealiasing. For example an IDIR or a BC Drivers Licence.

column.name: person_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for an person. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: first_name
column.remarks: The first name of a person.

column.name: middle_name_1
column.remarks: The first middle name of a person.

column.name: middle_name_2
column.remarks: Any remaining middle names beyond the first of a person.

column.name: last_name
column.remarks: The last name of a person.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the person.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the person.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the person was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the person.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the person.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the person was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: person_h
table.remarks: History table for person table

column.name: h_person_guid
column.remarks: System generated unique key for person history. This key should never be exposed to users via any system utilizing the tables.

column.name: target_row_id
column.remarks: The unique key for the person that has been created or modified.

column.name: operation_type
column.remarks: The operation performed: I = Insert, U = Update, D = Delete

column.name: operation_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created or modified the data in the person table. Defaults to the logged in user if not passed in by the application.

column.name: operation_executed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp when the data in the person table was created or modified. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: data_after_executed_operation
column.remarks: A JSON representation of the row in the table after the operation was completed successfully. This implies that the latest row in the audit table will always match with the current row in the live table.

table.name: species_code
table.remarks: The species involved in a Human Wildlife Conflict (E.g. BLKBEAR = Black Bear; WOLVERN = Wolverine)

column.name: species_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a wildlife species.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the species code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the species code.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the species code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the species code is active.

column.name: legacy_code
column.remarks: The code for the species from the CORS_SPECIES_CODE table in the COORS database.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the species code.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the species code.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the species code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the species code.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the species code.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the species code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

table.name: violation_code
table.remarks: The alleged violation involved in the complaint. (E.g. ORV = Off Road Vehicles; PESTICDE = Pesticide)

column.name: violation_code
column.remarks: A human readable code used to identify a violation.

column.name: short_description
column.remarks: The short description of the violation code.

column.name: long_description
column.remarks: The long description of the violation code.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The order in which the values of the violation code table should be displayed when presented to a user in a list.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: A boolean indicator to determine if the violation code is active.

column.name: create_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that created the violation code.

column.name: create_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that created the violation code.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the violation code was created. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.

column.name: update_user_id
column.remarks: The id of the user that updated the violation code.

column.name: update_user_guid
column.remarks: The unique guid of the user that updated the violation code.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the violation code was updated. The timestamp is stored in UTC with no Offset.
